001package xjtlu.cpt111.assignment.quiz.lang;
002
003import java.util.Collections;
004import java.util.HashMap;
005import java.util.Map;
006
007/**
008 * This is a utility class to convert named XML Entities (such as &oslash;) into
009 * its HTML encoded Unicode code point (i.e. &amp;#248;). This is a slightly
010 * modified (class/method rename) from an SO answer:
011 * https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7286428/help-the-java-sax-parser-to-understand-bad-xml
012 *
013 * @author https://stackoverflow.com/users/823393/oldcurmudgeon
014 */
015public class XmlEntity {
016        /**
017         * The map of HTML entities.
018         */
019        private static final Map<String, Integer> SPECIALS;
020
021        // <editor-fold defaultstate="collapsed" desc="Initialize SPECIALS">
022        /*
023         * Create a map HTML Named Entities to their numeric equivalent. Derived from
024         * Wikipedia
025         * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_XML_and_HTML_character_entity_references
026         */

028                final Map<String, Integer> map = new HashMap<>();
029                map.put("quot", 34);

268                map.put("otimes", 8855);
269                map.put("perp", 8869);
270                map.put("sdot", 8901);
271                map.put("lceil", 8968);
272                map.put("rceil", 8969);
273                map.put("lfloor", 8970);
274                map.put("rfloor", 8971);
275                map.put("lang", 10216);
276                map.put("rang", 10217);
277                map.put("loz", 9674);
278                map.put("spades", 9824);
279                map.put("clubs", 9827);
280                map.put("hearts", 9829);
281                map.put("diams", 9830);
282                SPECIALS = Collections.unmodifiableMap(map);
283        }
284        // </editor-fold>
285
286        /**
287         * Private constructor for a utility class.
288         */
289        private XmlEntity() {
290        }
291
292        /**
293         * Converts a named XML entity into its HTML encoded Unicode code point.
294         *
295         * @param s the named entity (note, this should not include the leading '&amp;'
296         *          or trailing ';'
297         * @return the HTML encoded Unicode code point representation of the named
298         *         entity
299         */
300        public static String fromNamedReference(CharSequence s) {
301                if (s == null) {
302                        return null;
303                }
304                final Integer code = SPECIALS.get(s.toString());
305                if (code != null) {
306                        return "&#" + code + ";";
307                }
308                return null;
309        }
310}
